forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 50, with temperatures rising to around 52 overnight. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night envelops Downtown San Francisco with a gentle grip, the air laden with anticipation as rain gathers its wits to make its entrance. A cloaking blanket of clouds hides the stars, while a soft breeze from the south carries whispers of moisture, promising wet streets by dawn. Low temperatures hover close to 50, with a slight rise in warmth as the night unfolds, hinting at the presence of a day that will be both tumultuous and beautiful.

As morning beckons, rain will embrace the city before retreating by the afternoon, revealing fleeting patches of sun that clash harmoniously with the drizzling remnants of the early hours. The high barely breaks into the 50s, and the persistent southwest wind suggests a chill that demands respect. The day may not appear as inviting as one hopes, with a 90% chance of precipitation and anticipated amounts reaching a half-inch. Clarity will wrestle with fog, as the marine layer dances around the Golden Gate and scales its way into the heart of the urban landscape. Wrap yourself warmly in layers, perhaps donning a water-resistant coat and sturdy shoes. Under these conditions, a stroll through the quiet, rain-soaked streets could be invigorating; consider slipping into a cozy café afterward, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee fills the air and the raindrops tap a soothing rhythm against the windows. Today’s silhouette is one of resilience, inviting moments of introspection as the city breathes, with each droplet painting its story onto the canvass of existence.
